title: Sheddric Fields
text:
Sheddric Fields is a retired record-setting <a href="long%20jumper">long jumper</a>. During his senior year of high school, he was named the 1991–92 <a href="Gatorade%20Player%20of%20the%20Year%20awards">Gatorade National High School Boys Track & Field Athlete of the Year</a>.
High school athletics.
Fields grew up in Dallas, where he graduated from <a href="South%20Oak%20Cliff%20High%20School">South Oak Cliff High School</a> in 1992. In high school, he set a national youth record in the long jump. As of 2021, he still has the 3rd longest long jump in U.S. high school history (26-8½ feet). He was rated by Track and Field News to be the top high school long jumper in the country during his junior and senior years, and he was named a high school All American both years. Fields also had the longest <a href="triple%20jump">triple jump</a> in Texas during his senior year.
For his records in the long jump, Fields was named the 1991–92 Gatorade National Boys Track & Field Player of the Year.
Fields also played defensive back for the South Oak Cliff football team.
College athletics.
Fields was recruited to run track at the <a href="University%20of%20Houston">University of Houston</a>.
At Houston, Fields was twice named an NCAA Division I All American in the long jump.
After athletics.
Fields has worked for the U.S. Postal Service since graduation.
He and Tamny Fields have 3 children, including Jayla, who, as of 2021, is an all conference sprinter at <a href="Northwestern%20State%20University">Northwestern State University</a>.She is now a member of the University of Houston track and field team.
